poem:
### Golden Shift

In deep-blue tides, an orange tide turned,  
counties slipped from grasp, quietly churned.  
The economy's whisper, a siren's hum,  
stirred restless minds in California's sun.  
Through redwood shadows, headlines tread,  
as campaigns weave in threads unsaid.  
A fleeting victory's silent roar,  
as voters ponder what they stand for.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Trump converts voters in deep-blue California – was it all about the economy? Donald Trump on 5 November expanded his coalition across the United States, and he did so even in deep-blue California. While Kamala Harris unsurprisingly beat out Trump in the Golden State – receiving about 60% of the vote – the former president nonetheless pulled off a victory, winning eight counties that supported Joe Biden in 2020. It may take years to fully". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
